title: How to Change the Sound Output on a Mac

steps.title: Click the Apple menu and select System Preferences.
steps.content: Click the Apple menu and select System Preferences . The Apple menu is at the top-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: The Sound icon looks like speaker.
steps.content: The Sound icon looks like speaker. This opens your sound settings.

steps.title: This tab is at the top of the window.
steps.content: This tab is at the top of the window. Your output settings will appear.

steps.title: Choose the device you want to hear audio from in the list.
steps.content: Choose the device you want to hear audio from in the list. This highlights the device.

steps.title: Adjust the volume and balance.
steps.content: Adjust the volume and balance. Click and drag the white notch under "Balance" to adjust your balance settings, and the white notch under "Output volume" to change volume settings. Your new settings will take effect instantly.
